intro: Tetrapterys subaptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically clustered in terminal spikes and are usually pink or purple in color. Tetrapterys subaptera is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
